content.title: Suprarenal Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm
content.description: An abdominal aortic aneurysm extending above the renal arteries to involve the suprarenal aorta, often approaching or involving the superior mesenteric artery.
content.definition: Suprarenal AAA extends proximal to the renal arteries into the suprarenal aortic segment but does not extend to involve the diaphragm. Represents the most complex isolated abdominal aortic aneurysm and approaches thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm (TAAA Type IV) when approaching the SMA origin.

key_anatomic_criteria: Aneurysm extends above both renal arteries
May involve SMA origin (transitional to TAAA IV)
Visceral vessel origins may arise from aneurysm
treatment_complexity: Multiple visceral vessel reconstructions often needed
High physiologic stress during open repair

learning_objectives: Define suprarenal AAA extent and distinguish from TAAA
Compare open vs complex endovascular repair
clinical_pearls: Suprarenal AAA vs TAAA IV distinction is often semantic - treatment is similar
Preoperative spinal drain placement reduces cord ischemia risk
Staged hybrid approach may reduce physiologic stress
Center volume and expertise significantly impact outcomes
